attractions.name: The Blue Lagoon
attractions.shortDescription: A famous geothermal spa with milky-blue waters.
attractions.description: The Blue Lagoon is a world-renowned geothermal spa located in a lava field near Grindavík. The warm, mineral-rich waters are believed to have healing properties.

attractions.name: Golden Circle
attractions.shortDescription: A popular tourist route with stunning natural sights.
attractions.description: The Golden Circle is a famous tourist route covering about 300 kilometers, including Þingvellir National Park, the Gullfoss waterfall, and the Geysir geothermal area.

attractions.name: Jökulsárlón Glacier Lagoon
attractions.shortDescription: A large glacial lake with floating icebergs.
attractions.description: Jökulsárlón is a large glacial lake on the edge of Vatnajökull National Park. It is famous for the icebergs that break off from the Breiðamerkurjökull glacier.

attractions.name: Diamond Beach
attractions.shortDescription: Black sand beach with washed-up icebergs.
attractions.description: Diamond Beach is a black sand beach located next to the Jökulsárlón Glacier Lagoon. It gets its name from the large chunks of ice that wash ashore and glisten like diamonds.

attractions.name: Skógafoss Waterfall
attractions.shortDescription: One of Iceland's largest and most beautiful waterfalls.
attractions.description: Skógafoss is a spectacular waterfall on the Skógá River. The waterfall produces a large amount of spray, often creating single or double rainbows on sunny days.

attractions.name: Reynisfjara Beach
attractions.shortDescription: A black sand beach with basalt columns and sea stacks.
attractions.description: Reynisfjara is a black pebble beach near the village of Vík. The beach is famous for its dramatic black sand, basalt columns, and the powerful Atlantic waves.

attractions.name: Hallgrímskirkja Church
attractions.shortDescription: An iconic Lutheran parish church in Reykjavík.
attractions.description: Hallgrímskirkja is the tallest church in Iceland and one of the country's most recognizable landmarks. Its unique design is inspired by the basalt columns found in Icelandic landscapes.

attractions.name: Myvatn Nature Baths
attractions.shortDescription: A natural lagoon with mineral-rich, geothermal water.
attractions.description: Often called the 'Blue Lagoon of the North,' the Myvatn Nature Baths offer a relaxing geothermal experience with stunning views of the surrounding volcanic landscape.

attractions.name: Gullfoss Waterfall
attractions.shortDescription: A magnificent two-tiered waterfall on the Hvítá River.
attractions.description: Gullfoss, or 'Golden Falls,' is one of Iceland's most famous waterfalls. It cascades down two distinct drops into a rugged canyon, creating a dramatic spectacle.

attractions.name: Þingvellir National Park
attractions.shortDescription: A UNESCO World Heritage site and a geological wonder.
attractions.description: Þingvellir holds historical significance as the site of Iceland's first parliament. It is also a geological marvel where the North American and Eurasian tectonic plates meet.

attractions.name: Geysir Geothermal Area
attractions.shortDescription: Home to the famous Strokkur geyser.
attractions.description: Part of the Golden Circle, the Geysir area is a hotbed of geothermal activity. Strokkur geyser erupts every few minutes, shooting a column of water up to 20 meters high.

attractions.name: Snæfellsjökull National Park
attractions.shortDescription: A national park centered around a stratovolcano glacier.
attractions.description: Snæfellsjökull is a magnificent glacier-capped volcano. The national park offers rugged landscapes, black sand beaches, and dramatic cliffs.

attractions.name: Landmannalaugar
attractions.shortDescription: A remote and beautiful region known for its rhyolite mountains.
attractions.description: Located in the Highlands, Landmannalaugar is famous for its colorful mountains, hot springs, and hiking trails. It is a popular destination for adventurers.

attractions.name: Vestrahorn Mountain
attractions.shortDescription: A stunning mountain on the Stokksnes peninsula.
attractions.description: Vestrahorn is a majestic mountain range on the Stokksnes peninsula, famous for its dramatic, jagged peaks and the reflection it creates on the black sand beach below.

attractions.name: Seljalandsfoss Waterfall
attractions.shortDescription: A unique waterfall you can walk behind.
attractions.description: Seljalandsfoss is a picturesque waterfall on the South Coast. A path allows visitors to walk behind the cascading water, offering a unique perspective and photo opportunity.
